Name: Avogadro's Number
Description: Avogadro's Number is used to calculate the number of atoms, molecules, or other entities in a given sample of a substance. It is also the base unit for the amount of substance in the International System of Units (SI).

Name: Boltzmann Constant
Description: The Boltzmann constant is used to relate the average kinetic energy of particles to the temperature of a system. It is also used to calculate the entropy of a system.

Name: Euler's Number
Description: Euler's Number is an important mathematical constant that is used to calculate exponential growth and decay. It is also used in calculus and other branches of mathematics.

Name: Gas Constant
Description: The Gas Constant is used to calculate the pressure, volume, and temperature of a gas. It is also used to calculate the energy of a system at a given temperature.

Name: Gravitational Constant
Description: The Gravitational Constant is used to calculate the force of gravity between two objects. It is also used to calculate the mass and radius of a given object.

Name: Planck's Constant
Description: Planck's Constant is used to calculate the energy of a photon, or the energy of a system in quantum mechanics. It is also used to calculate the angular momentum of a system.

Name: Pi
Description: Pi is an important mathematical constant used to calculate the circumference and area of a circle, as well as the volume of a sphere. It is also used in calculus and other branches of mathematics.

Name: Speed of Light in a Vacuum
Description: The Speed of Light in a Vacuum is the speed at which light travels in a vacuum. It is used to calculate the wavelength of a wave and is used in relativity and quantum mechanics.

Name: Stefan-Boltzmann Constant
Description: The Stefan-Boltzmann Constant is used to calculate the total energy emitted by a black body in a given temperature. It is also used to calculate the total energy in a given system.
